content: I took on the VA for a thirty year struggle getting them to recognize my issues. It wasn't until my Mother asked me if I needed some papers she had in her possession. They were my medical records. All of the copies I had by habit collected like they were stocks and bonds. I got that habit from my Mother and she kept them in her stuff all these years. It opened doors I never knew were there. I hope Dennis gets the help he needs and good luck to both of you. PS Dennis can speel and articulate his words, how come he doesn't get online with us? Too silly for him? Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?

content: I fought with the V.A. for 10 years befor I was finily able to get my service connected disability. The V.A. kept telling me my records were burned in a fire in St. Louis mo. I knew this was a lie because that is also what they told my older brother that was in the service 10 years befor I inlisted. I asked them how many fires they have at that record center. I finily contacted a state senitor and he was able to not only get my records but he sent them to the surgen general and had the surgen general note all the things that were service connected. it took me 10 years to get this done. D.J.
